com.hoosteen.tree

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hoosteen.tree.Node
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Node>, java.lang.Iterable<Node>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ClassTime, Course, Schedule, Section

    public abstract class Node
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<Node>, java.lang.Comparable<Node>
    Abstract class. A Node is a member of a figurative tree. There is no tree object, but each node can function as a tree if it has no parent. It can be expanded, selected, and hidden. Nodes can contain any number of other nodes Nodes are Iterable, Serializable, and Comparable
    Author:
    Justin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
